A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Created an account especially for this.

Dear God what a piece of shit movie. Ok let me rephrase this: what an outstanding disapointment this turns out to be.

Character development is a MASSIVE let down. Premises established in the preceding episode are royally shat upon. New "diversified" (lol) characters you couldn't care less about (except perhaps Benicio Del Toro) are forcefed down your throat with nothing enticing to look for and old characters are literally thrown out the window (yeah I'm thinking about Leia -
 she comes back from the window ;) in a fucking ridiculous scene I might add).

Every loose ends remain loose\, none of your questions will be answered (if you had any) and nothing ends up tied. Looking forward to ignore the next installment altogether.

A big fuck you from a SJW director that didn't realize he had a Star Wars movie in his hands
